content:
• Tuesday, April 10, 2012
  • PRXI

    Premier Exhibitions (OTC:PRXI) cancels its press conference slated for April 11, saying it's in...

    Premier Exhibitions (OTC:PRXI) cancels its press conference slated for April 11, saying it's in talks with multiple parties for the purchase of its Titanic artifacts collection. The company says it plans to conduct negotiations and due diligence in confidence and will provide an update as soon as practical. Shares -5.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • SMSC

    More on Standard Microsystems (NASDAQ:SMSC): Q4 beat on a per share basis, but missed the mark...

    More on Standard Microsystems (NASDAQ:SMSC): Q4 beat on a per share basis, but missed the mark on revenue as the swung to a loss on stock-based compensation, restructuring and other charges, plus weak sales demand. The stock is up after hours however, as the company guides Q1 higher, now expecting to earn between $0.29 - $0.38 per share, above Street EPS expectations of $0.27. Shares +4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM
  • AMCC

    Applied Micro Circuits (NASDAQ:AMCC) -5.9% AH after issuing downward guidance for Q4, seeing...

    Applied Micro Circuits (NASDAQ:AMCC) -5.9% AH after issuing downward guidance for Q4, seeing revenues 6% below its previous forecast of $52M and a non-GAAP EPS loss of $0.10-$0.12 vs. a consensus loss of $0.08. The shortfall "is related to slowness in the service provider space and the overall wire line market weakness,” AMCC says.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • BBY

    Brian Dunn's resignation as CEO of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) came before the completion of a...

    Brian Dunn's resignation as CEO of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) came before the completion of a personal-misconduct probe, Minneapolis' Star Tribune reports - which might explain the sudden move just 10 days after talk of his spearheading an accelerated restructuring plan. BBY closed down 5.9%, now up 1.2% AH. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (NYSE:OI) +7.8% AH following upward Q1 guidance forecasting EPS from continuing...

    Owens-Illinois (NYSE:OI) +7.8% AH following upward Q1 guidance forecasting EPS from continuing operations more than 35% higher than the prior year's $0.50, "primarily driven by good manufacturing performance as the company's facilities operated at greater than planned production rates."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • OPNT-OLD

    Opnet Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD) -7.3% AH after lowering guidance for FQ4 earnings and...

    Opnet Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD) -7.3% AH after lowering guidance for FQ4 earnings and revenue, pointing to purchasing delays associated with deals dxpected to close during the quarter. Bookings for application performance management rose 37% Y/Y and accelerated from the growth rate of the first three quarters of FY 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MFRM

    More on Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Easily beats Q4 estimates on a 47% jump in net sales and a...

    More on Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Easily beats Q4 estimates on a 47% jump in net sales and a 61% Y/Y rise in gross profit. The company guides FY12 higher, now expecting $1.40 - $1.48 per share. Street estimates are for $1.37. Separately the company also buys Mattress Giant for approximately $47M in cash. Shares +9.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) President & COO Kenneth May steps down citing personal reasons. The company...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) President & COO Kenneth May steps down citing personal reasons. The company says CEO James Morgan has reassumed the position of President of the Company, effective immediately. Shares +1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): FQ4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.37. Revenue of $188.6M (+47.9% Y/Y)...

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): FQ4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.37. Revenue of $188.6M (+47.9% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): Q1 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $6.01B (flat Y/Y) beats by $240M....

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): Q1 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $6.01B (flat Y/Y) beats by $240M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 44 Comments
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA -3%) kicks off earnings season after the close, and its results “will show the...

    Alcoa (AA -3%) kicks off earnings season after the close, and its results “will show the limits of even the most ruthlessly efficient organization in the face of a challenging economy.” Analysts will want to hear more about Alcoa’s biggest problem: China. Increased output has created an aluminum glut that’s been squeezing smelting margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • SAN

    It was a bad day for European bank stocks, as shares of several fell as much as 8% on renewed...

    It was a bad day for European bank stocks, as shares of several fell as much as 8% on renewed concerns that countries like Spain and Italy won't be able to pay their debts. The yield on Spanish 10-year bonds spiked to nearly 6%; in U.S. trading, STD -3.5% and BBVA -3.2%. UniCredit (OTCPK:UNCFF) -8.1% in Italy. Also: DB -3.3%, BCS -5.3%, UBS -4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • TUES

    Tuesday Morning (TUES -3.4%) slips after saying earlier that its Q3 same-store sales decreased...

    Tuesday Morning (TUES -3.4%) slips after saying earlier that its Q3 same-store sales decreased by 3.2%, and projected a loss for the quarter between $0.09 $0.11 per share. Street estimates were for a loss per share of $0.08.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • HALO

    Shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO -12%) plunge after Jefferies cuts its rating to Hold from...

    Shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO -12%) plunge after Jefferies cuts its rating to Hold from Buy, noting likely market challenges for three products to be launched by the biopharma company's partners. HALO's royalty revenue is unlikely to drive further appreciation for the stock, the firm adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • THC

    Tenet Healthcare (THC -1.6%) agrees to pay $43M to settle a government inquiry into allegations...

    Tenet Healthcare (THC -1.6%) agrees to pay $43M to settle a government inquiry into allegations it overbilled for Medicare treatment. The cash payment for the settlement will be paid in Q2 out of funds already reserved by the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • AVP

    Caris says a higher bid for Avon (AVP -1.6%) from Coty is even more unlikely with a new CEO, but...

    Caris says a higher bid for Avon (AVP -1.6%) from Coty is even more unlikely with a new CEO, but the firm still finds plenty of reasons to “remain constructive” on AVP shares, as “the long-term earnings and cash flow upside from operational improvement under a new CEO is substantial."Â Shares remain below last week's $23.25/share offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • CECE

    CECO Environmental (CECE +1.2%) remains firmly in the green after saying earlier it had received...

    CECO Environmental (CECE +1.2%) remains firmly in the green after saying earlier it had received several new orders totaling over $4.3M. The new orders consist of five from U.S. clients in the aluminum, chemical, power and refining industries, and two from customers in China and Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • LVS

    Casino stocks fail to hold morning highs attained after the Nevada Gaming Control Board said...

    Casino stocks fail to hold morning highs attained after the Nevada Gaming Control Board said February statewide gambling revenue jumped 5.7% to $932.2M; on the Vegas Strip, revenue rose 3.3% to $530.7M. Shares of Las Vegas Sands (LVS -5.1%), Wynn (WYNN -2.1%) and MGM (MGM -2.8%) were unable to maintain gains in the face of the broader market selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN -2.1%) plans to add a feature to it apps for Kindle and Android devices that allows...

    Amazon (AMZN -2.1%) plans to add a feature to it apps for Kindle and Android devices that allows users to make purchases using the firm's one-click purchasing feature. The move should help Amazon attract better apps and content by empowering developers to charge for digital content and subscriptions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • FSIN

    Watch out below? Muddy Waters lines up Fushi Copperweld (FSIN +2.2%) in its sights as the next...

    Watch out below? Muddy Waters lines up Fushi Copperweld (FSIN +2.2%) in its sights as the next China-based company with possible links to fraud. Share took a dip lower after the report was released, but are still in positive territory - adding a bit more to the theory that the once-powerful Muddy Waters Effect may be fading (previous).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVVC

    Firsthand Technology Value Fund (NASDAQ:SVVC) pops a 8.8% gain after the fund discloses that its...

    Firsthand Technology Value Fund (NASDAQ:SVVC) pops a 8.8% gain after the fund discloses that its latest position in Facebook is up to 600K shares. Holdings in the fund that specializes in private tech names include Facebook (26%), Intevac (5%), Silicon Genesis (4%), and Yelp (3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 2 Comments

  • After hanging around quietly in the red most of the day, gold and silver have charged higher in...

    After hanging around quietly in the red most of the day, gold and silver have charged higher in the last 30 minutes. Gold +0.8% to $1,657/oz., silver +0.6% to $31.71/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • FCX

    Crude oil touches a 2-month low of $100.83/barrel as it follows risk markets downward. USO -1%,...

    Crude oil touches a 2-month low of $100.83/barrel as it follows risk markets downward. USO -1%, BNO -1.7%. Another economically sensitive commodity, copper falls back to mid-January levels at $3.65/lb. JJC -1.8%. Freeport-McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) gives up big early 2012 gains to slip into the red on the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL -3.1%) still has trouble on its Starboard side, even after selling its patents to...

    AOL (AOL -3.1%) still has trouble on its Starboard side, even after selling its patents to Microsoft for $1B and boosting the value of activist investor Starboard's shares by ~43% since last week. Starboard says in a new letter that the patent sale "does little to address our serious concerns" with AOL’s operating performance and losses in the display ad business.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • ORIG

    Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG -4.3%) slips after unveiling plans for a bigger-sized offer of up to $175M...

    Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG -4.3%) slips after unveiling plans for a bigger-sized offer of up to $175M of its shares by its biggest shareholder, dry-bulk shipper DryShips (DRYS -1.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP -4.8%) slides after Auriga downgrades the stock to Hold from Buy and...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP -4.8%) slides after Auriga downgrades the stock to Hold from Buy and lowers its price target to $51 from $54. The firm says SLXP shares appear to have already priced in upside from the potential approval of developmental drugs Relistor and Crofelemer. Auriga had upgraded shares to Buy only six weeks ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM

  • European markets accelerate their slide 15 minutes before the close. Stoxx 50 -2.7%, led by...

    European markets accelerate their slide 15 minutes before the close. Stoxx 50 -2.7%, led by Italy, -5.1%, Spain -2.7%. Banking shares lead the way: Unicredit -7.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • PALDF

    Shares of North American Palladium (PAL +4.4%) stir up a gain after the miner announces Q1...

    Shares of North American Palladium (PAL +4.4%) stir up a gain after the miner announces Q1 production of 41.76K ounces of palladium at an average cost of $380/oz. The company also affirms its 2012 production guidance for 150K-160K ounces of the metal at a cost per ounce ranging from $375 to $400.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 3 Comments
  • CREE

    Lighting manufacturer Cree (CREE +7.2%) says it has halved the cost of its LED streetlights and...

    Lighting manufacturer Cree (CREE +7.2%) says it has halved the cost of its LED streetlights and hopes the new lower prices will sway local governments to adopt the new technology. Cree's new outdoor streetlight will sell for under $200 when bought in volume, comparable in cost to traditional lighting using high-pressure sodium vacuum technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +0.7%) moves up as chatter percolates that the company is in play as a...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +0.7%) moves up as chatter percolates that the company is in play as a takeover target.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 4 Comments
  • RJF

    Raymond James (RJF +1.5%) jumps after Wells Fargo initiates coverage of the brokerage at...

    Raymond James (RJF +1.5%) jumps after Wells Fargo initiates coverage of the brokerage at Outperform as “one of the best-run firms in financial services, and we attractively view its low-risk private client focused business model." The firm likes RJF's acquisition of Morgan Keegan as "a meaningful EPS driver near term," particularly if the economy improves.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +2.4%) says it received a $50M development-milestone payment from Takeda...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +2.4%) says it received a $50M development-milestone payment from Takeda Pharmaceutical (TKPYY.PK), triggered by the FDA's approval of its Omontys anemia drug late last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -2.3%) reverses the 4% gain it had in the wake of CEO Brian Dunn's resignation....

    Best Buy (BBY -2.3%) reverses the 4% gain it had in the wake of CEO Brian Dunn's resignation. The CNBC effect at work? Or are investors accounting for the damage that's happened to the retailer in the entertainment business? Herb Greenberg crows that three of his five worst CEOs are now out.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 3 Comments
  • YELP

    Shares of Yelp (YELP +4.8%) follow up on yesterday's rally after the Facebook-Instagram marriage...

    Shares of Yelp (YELP +4.8%) follow up on yesterday's rally after the Facebook-Instagram marriage was announced with another steady gain. The tidy premium Instagram commanded has helped focus investors back on Yelp's attractive 67M page views a month and its gradual ascendancy to verb status (Yelp this restaurant to see if it's rated high).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU +1.1%) holds its own this morning on positive comments out of ThinkEquity. After...

    Baidu (BIDU +1.1%) holds its own this morning on positive comments out of ThinkEquity. After conducting checks, the firm sees BIDU's consensus Q1 revenue estimates as "reasonable," and thinks the company's 2012 guidance may surpass Street expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • MSFT

    Jumping out in Microsoft's (MSFT -0.2%) $1B deal for AOL's (AOL -1.9%) patents is the huge...

    Jumping out in Microsoft's (MSFT -0.2%) $1B deal for AOL's (AOL -1.9%) patents is the huge break-up fee: $211M - 20% of the deal price - if it doesn’t close in a timely manner. WSJ reports the high fee represents the culmination of a “really competitive” auction process, in which AOL was concerned with the specific terms of the deal and not the price tag alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • GERN

    Geron (GERN +3.3%) shoots higher after landing patent approval for a treatment method for...

    Geron (GERN +3.3%) shoots higher after landing patent approval for a treatment method for central nervous system-related tumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • SWY

    Shares of Safeway (SWY +2.4%) ride higher after the company names insider Robert Edwards to...

    Shares of Safeway (SWY +2.4%) ride higher after the company names insider Robert Edwards to replace Steve Burd as president.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • ARQL

    Shares of ArQule (ARQL -6.3%) fall off after the biotech company files with the SEC for a public...

    Shares of ArQule (ARQL -6.3%) fall off after the biotech company files with the SEC for a public offering of 6M shares of its common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy at Lazard, citing valuation and recent awards. The...

    AeroVironment (AVAV +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy at Lazard, citing valuation and recent awards. The firm says it believes the company, which designs and makes small unmanned aircraft systems, should benefit from the shift to precision guided munitions across the military and that the Defense Department's move to common architectures also will benefit AVAV.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN +7.2%) comes out of the gate strong, helped out in part with word that the firm...

    Renren (RENN +7.2%) comes out of the gate strong, helped out in part with word that the firm entered an agreement with Japan's Snapdish to share food photos through an iOS app.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY +3.7%) CEO Brian Dunn resigns that post and his board position, with "no...

    Best Buy (BBY +3.7%) CEO Brian Dunn resigns that post and his board position, with "no disagreements" relating to operations or procedures, but a "mutual agreement that it was time for new leadership." G. Mike Mikan is named interim CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    More on the DELL-OLD upgrade: Katy Huberty says recent acquisitions by the company "partly...

    More on the DELL-OLD upgrade: Katy Huberty says recent acquisitions by the company "partly addresses Dell's mix challenges" as it continues to diversify its business away from personal computers. She ups FY13 profits to $2.10 from $1.93. Shares +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • SNE

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) trade 7.6% lower premarket after the company reports that it will see...

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) trade 7.6% lower premarket after the company reports that it will see a bigger loss for the past financial year than originally forecast. The company pins the slow sales of TVs in the U.S. as a major factor that pushed earnings lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • XRIT

    Premarket gainers: XRIT +39%. NBG +27%. SVU +16%. YPF +8%. AKRX +8%. LGF +3%.Losers: VPHM -20%....

    Premarket gainers: XRIT +39%. NBG +27%. SVU +16%. YPF +8%. AKRX +8%. LGF +3%.
    Losers: VPHM -20%. TRGT -9%. SNE -8%. STD -4%. STM -4%. AU -3%. TS -3%. MT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • CBIO

    Targacept (TRGT) -10.3% premarket after announcing revised top-line results from its exploratory...

    Targacept (TRGT) -10.3% premarket after announcing revised top-line results from its exploratory Phase 2 study of TC-6987 in asthma show it no longer achieves protocol-defined success criteria on the primary endpoint of Forced Expiratory Volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • AKRX

    Akorn (NASDAQ:AKRX) moves up 6.4% in premarket trading after the smoke clears for it to launch a...

    Akorn (NASDAQ:AKRX) moves up 6.4% in premarket trading after the smoke clears for it to launch a generic version of Vancocin. It's a different story at ViroPharma (VPHM), -21.3% premarket, where a new FTC investigation into the company over unfair methods of competition add to its headaches.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) +1.7% premarket after saying it’s teaming up with Lockheed Martin...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) +1.7% premarket after saying it’s teaming up with Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) to pursue the U.S. government’s biggest IT contract. Dell would provide computers and support services as part of the five-year, $7.5B Navy agreement, says the general manager of Dell's federal government business. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • SVU

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU) powers up a 16.1% premarket gain following its Q4 earnings beat and...

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU) powers up a 16.1% premarket gain following its Q4 earnings beat and better-than-expected outlook for FY12 EPS. It's welcome relief for the company after hearing the B-word bandied about and seeing bearish bets on its stock pile up relentlessly.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • VVUS

    Leerink Swann weighs in on the delay the FDA imposed on Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) over approval for...

    Leerink Swann weighs in on the delay the FDA imposed on Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) over approval for its Qnexa weight-loss drug, saying the firm should still have "firstmover advantage" for the highly-anticipated drug. Shares of VVUS have trimmed their premarket loss to -0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM | 4 Comments
  • SHPG

    Shares of ViroPharma (VPHM) sink 18.4% premarket after rivals Watson Pharmaceuticals and Akorn...

    Shares of ViroPharma (VPHM) sink 18.4% premarket after rivals Watson Pharmaceuticals and Akorn (NASDAQ:AKRX) both launch generic versions of Vancocin. The company says that it intends to file a complaint seeking an injunction to set aside the FDA approvals on the drugs and restore its exclusivity.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • SVU

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $8.23B (-5% Y/Y) misses by...

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $8.23B (-5% Y/Y) misses by $80M. Shares +10.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    DELL-OLD is upgraded to Equalweight from Underweight at Morgan Stanley. Shares +1.2% premarket.

    DELL-OLD is upgraded to Equalweight from Underweight at Morgan Stanley. Shares +1.2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • PPL

    PPL Corp. (NYSE:PPL) announces the public offering of 9.9M shares of its common stock, set to...

    PPL Corp. (NYSE:PPL) announces the public offering of 9.9M shares of its common stock, set to occur around April 13. The company says it plans to use the proceeds to make capital contributions to subsidiaries and repay short-term debt obligations. Shares -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 AM
  • ARNA

    Weight-loss stocks Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) and Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX)...

    Weight-loss stocks Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) and Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) are on the radar of traders after rival Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) lands a 3-month PDUA extension from the FDA for Qnexa. The decision pushes back the target date for the agency to consider the closely-watched drug's safety plan to July 17 from April 17. Premarket: ARNA +2.6%, OREX +2.3%, VVUS -7.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 AM
